interestingcomments.content: Andy, Aren't you simply saying that your one program with data needs to reside on your boot drive? And for redundancy you also have a clone of your boot drive on another bootable drive? If so, that can be easily accomplished with the nMP of late 2013.
interestingcomments.MarkedSent: Andy, Aren't you simply saying that your one program with data needs to reside on your boot drive? And for redundancy you also have a clone of your boot drive on another bootable drive? If so, that can be easily accomplished with the nMP of late 2013.

interestingcomments.content: The app as such probably won’t provide any useful data as it only captures isolated incidents that are insufficient for predicting anything. This project needs thousands of smartphones running the app in a certain area so that particle showers or local radiation levels can be calculated from the data supplied by the participating phones. I suppose those results – if derived in real time – could be sent back to the apps and be displayed in some way. The practical use of this would probably be limited; this is all about the advancement of science so far.
interestingcomments.MarkedSent: The app as such probably won’t provide any useful data as it only captures isolated incidents that are insufficient for predicting anything. This project needs thousands of smartphones running the app in a certain area so that particle showers or local radiation levels can be calculated from the data supplied by the participating phones. I suppose those results – if derived in real time – could be sent back to the apps and be displayed in some way. The practical use of this would probably be limited; this is all about the advancement of science so far.

interestingcomments.content: I have booked Celal Sultan Hotel, just behind Hagia Sophia Hotel and up the road from Sultanahmet Park, but more importantly, around the corner from Dubb Indian Restaurant (who are still advertising their 2010 New Year Party - sounds perfect). Just me and a camera bag. a bit of a palavar with Travelpony, but they gave me an extra discount as their photos did not match up to the photos from the hotel's own web site. Edited September 1, 2014 by Sandokan

interestingcomments.content: Because the proposed meeting date and venue are squarely within the G20 disruptions, the only option for me from the southwest suburbs is two hours each way by train and walking plus whichever security inspections/delays may be involved. Buses will be impossible and car access/parking is hardly likely to be better! Perhaps for visitors staying within the death zones:rolleyes: the venue and date may make perfect sense! Pick anywhere else in Brisbane outside the restricted areas and I'll make my best efforts to attend and bring lots of Leica stuff to be played with.
